so_35941693: size of images in bash
Top-3 Scripts:
so_32632374: PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin
where=$(dirname $1)
for f in "$@"
do
   convert ${where}/BG.png "$f" -composite ${where}/result.jpg
done

PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin
where=$(dirname $1)
DESKTOP=${HOME}/Desktop
# `~/Desktop' will also work in this example
for f in "$@"
do
   convert ${where}/BG.png "$f" -composite ${DESKTOP}/result.jpg
done

so_35941693: #!/bin/bash
shopt -s nullglob

cd  /opt/ADL_db/Users/mkhalil/OpenCV/positive

for f in *.png *.jpg *.jpeg; do
   read w h < <(convert "$f" -format "%w %h" info:)
   echo $f, $w, $h
done

convert /opt/ADL_db/Users/mkhalil/OpenCV/positive/*.{jpg,png,jpeg} -format "%f %w %h\n" info:

done

so_67570276: #!/bin/bash
if [ -f "$1" ]; then
   if [ -d "$2" ] ; then
      cp "$1" / "$2"
      echo "$4"
   fi
else 
   echo "$3"
   exit 1
fi

cp "$1" "$2"

Performs the specified action on the files. Valid actions are view, cat (uses only
 "copiousoutput" rules and sends output to STDOUT) , compose, composetyped, edit and
 print. If no action is specified, the action will be determined by how the program
 was called.

so_35941693: #!/bin/bash
shopt -s nullglob

cd  /opt/ADL_db/Users/mkhalil/OpenCV/positive

for f in *.png *.jpg *.jpeg; do
   read w h < <(convert "$f" -format "%w %h" info:)
   echo $f, $w, $h
done

convert /opt/ADL_db/Users/mkhalil/OpenCV/positive/*.{jpg,png,jpeg} -format "%f %w %h\n" info:

Explanations about Options.-f:
Enable binary output on terminals. Normally, opt will refuse to write raw bitcode
 output if the output stream is a terminal. With this option, opt will write raw
 bitcode regardless of the output device.
